TITLE: House leadership is in limbo as McCarthy loses 3 rounds of voting for speaker
SUMMARY: House Republican Leader Kevin McCarthy, R-Calif., speaks after a closed-door meeting Tuesday morning with the GOP conference as he pursues the speaker of the House

TITLE: This was supposed to be Kevin McCarthy's moment. Instead, GOP chaos reigns
SUMMARY: Then-House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy, R-Calif., talks to reporters during a news conference following a GOP caucus meeting at the U.S. Capitol on Feb. 13, 2019

TITLE: The 118th Congress is off to a historic start. Here's a look at the first day
SUMMARY: The House of Representatives holds a vote on speaker of the House on Jan. 3, the first day of the 118th Congress. Kent Nishimura/Los Angeles Times via Getty Images

TITLE: Biden announces new border control measures and legal pathways to some migrants
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden speaks about border security in the Roosevelt Room of the White House, on Thursday. Vice President Kamala Harris stands at left. Biden plans to visit the southern U.S. border next week

TITLE: The House last struggled to elect a speaker 100 years ago. Here's what happened
SUMMARY: Rep. Kevin McCarthy, R-Calif., is flanked by Rep. Patrick McHenry, R-N.C., left, and Rep. Tom Emmer, R-Minn., right, in the House chamber as lawmakers meet for a second day to elect a speaker and convene the 118th Congress

TITLE: Millions of workers are subject to noncompete agreements. They could soon be banned
SUMMARY: The FTC proposed a new rule banning noncompete agreements. Federal Trade Commission chair Lina M. Khan calls them exploitative and widespread

TITLE: Trump and two rioters are sued over the death of Capitol Police officer Brian Sicknick
SUMMARY: The hearse carrying the remains of Capitol Police officer Brian Sicknick drives past police officers saluting after a funeral ceremony at the US Capitol February 3, 2021 in Washington, DC

TITLE: Meet Cheryl Johnson, the House clerk managing the speaker votes
SUMMARY: House Clerk Cheryl Johnson receives a standing ovation in the House chamber on Thursday, the third day of speaker elections

TITLE: These 21 House members didn't vote for Kevin McCarthy. Here's what they want
SUMMARY: Rep. Kevin McCarthy, R-Calif., returns to his office following another disappointing day for the House majority leader. McCarthy has so far failed to become speaker after six rounds of votes

TITLE: Biden's national security adviser is hopeful war over Taiwan can be prevented
SUMMARY: NPR's Steve Inskeep interviews U.S. President Joe Biden's national security adviser Jake Sullivan in Washington, D.C. on Jan. 5, 2023

TITLE: With a debt ceiling fight expected, McCarthy suggests a possible deal with Democrats
SUMMARY: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy, R-Calif., speaks at a news conference in Statuary Hall of the U.S. Capitol Building on Thursday

TITLE: A special counsel will probe government documents at Biden's home and private office
SUMMARY: Robert Hur has been appointed as special counsel to investigate how classified documents came to be located at President Biden's Delaware residence and at a Washington, D.C., think tank office

TITLE: Biden's lawyer says additional classified documents found, GOP calls for new probes
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden listens to a reporters question after speaking about the economy at the Eisenhower Executive Office Building on Thursday

TITLE: Who is Robert Hur, the special counsel leading the Biden classified documents inquiry
SUMMARY: Robert Hur speaks in 2018 when he was the U.S. attorney in Maryland. On Thursday he was appointed by Attorney General Merrick Garland as special counsel to investigate whether President Biden improperly handled classified documents

TITLE: Jurors in the Proud Boys trial hear the start of the seditious conspiracy case
SUMMARY: Proud Boys leader Enrique Tarrio, seen in May 2021, is on trial in Washington, accused of crimes related to the Jan. 6 storming of the Capitol. Chandan Khanna/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: The U.S. could hit its debt ceiling within days. Here's what you need to know.
SUMMARY: U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen listens to President Biden discuss the federal debt limit on Oct. 6, 2021, in Washington, D.C

TITLE: DOJ appeal in Texas mass shooting case pleases NRA and puzzles gun control advocates
SUMMARY: Visitors tour the First Baptist Church of Sutherland Springs in Texas after it was turned into a memorial to honor those who died during the November 2017 shooting. The Department of Justice is appealing the decision from a district court that found the government 60% responsible for the massacre

TITLE: Here's what we know about the classified documents found at Biden's home and office
SUMMARY: President Biden pictured at his home office in his private residence in Wilmington, Del., in 2021. This week, the Department of Justice announced that improperly stored classified documents had been discovered at the president's Wilmington home

TITLE: The U.S. has an overclassification problem, says one former special counsel
SUMMARY: The U.S. government classifies some 50 million documents every year, but doesn't declassify documents at nearly that rate. Bloomberg via Getty Images

TITLE: Classified documents found at Pence's Indiana home
SUMMARY: Former Vice President Mike Pence, shown here last month in Rock Hill, S.C., stored a "small number" of documents bearing classified markings in his Indiana home after having been "inadvertently" boxed up. They have been collected by the FBI

TITLE: The U.S. and Germany pledge tanks to Ukraine, signaling heavy fighting ahead
SUMMARY: U.S. Abrams tanks participate in a live fire demonstration during training exercises in Poland in September 2022. President Biden announced Wednesday that the U.S. will be sending 31 Abrams tanks to Ukraine. Germany also said it will be sending tanks

TITLE: McConnell says McCarthy should take the lead on negotiating the debt ceiling standoff
SUMMARY: Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell addressed the looming debt limit problem during a press conference on January 24

TITLE: Meta allows Donald Trump back on Facebook and Instagram
SUMMARY: Suspending former President Donald Trump's account was the most high-profile and controversial content moderation decision Facebook parent Meta has ever made. Alon Skuy/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: Democrats are crying foul as House Republicans sort key committee assignments
SUMMARY: Rep. Adam Schiff, D-Calif., center, with Rep. Eric Swalwell, D-Calif., left, and Rep. Ilhan Omar, D-Minn., during a news conference on Capitol Hill in Washington on Wednesday

TITLE: New 'Latino' and 'Middle Eastern or North African' checkboxes proposed for U.S. forms
SUMMARY: New proposals by the Biden administration would change how the U.S. census and federal surveys ask Latinos about their race and ethnicity and add a checkbox for "Middle Eastern or North African" to those forms

TITLE: Rep. Adam Schiff announces 2024 Senate run, teeing up a high-profile primary
SUMMARY: Rep. Adam Schiff, D-Calif., delivers remarks during a hearing by the House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack on the U.S. Capitol on June 21, 2022

TITLE: Newly released video of the attack on Paul Pelosi shows a struggle for a hammer
SUMMARY: In this image taken from San Francisco Police Department body-camera video, Paul Pelosi (right) fights for control of a hammer with his assailant during a brutal attack on Oct. 28, 2022. San Francisco Police Department via AP

TITLE: U.S. employers added 517,000 jobs last month. It's a surprisingly strong number
SUMMARY: A 'help wanted' sign is displayed in a window of a store in Manhattan, New York City, on Dec. 2, 2022. U.S. employers added an unexpectedly strong 517,000 jobs in January, showcasing the labor market is red-hot. The unemployment rate fell to its lowest level in more than half a century

SUMMARY: People cheer during the Democratic National Committee 2023 Winter meeting in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania on February 3, 2023. ANDREW CABALLERO-REYNOLDS/AFP via Getty Images

SUMMARY: Last week in Florida, at the University of Tampa, President Joe Biden promised to protect and strengthen Social Security and Medicare, as well as lower health care costs. Mandel Ngan/AFP via Getty Images

SUMMARY: The U.S. Supreme Court will hear arguments next term about whether Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, set up after the 2008 financial crisis to protect consumers from predatory lending practices, is funded constitutionally

SUMMARY: Michigan Rep. Elissa Slotkin, at a campaign rally in East Lansing, Mich., last November. Slotkin, who was reelected to a third term in the House in the 2022 midterms, announced Monday that she's running for the Senate in 2024

SUMMARY: During a visit to East Palestine, Ohio, former President Donald Trump stands in front of a pallet of "Trump"-branded water before delivering remarks at the East Palestine Fire Department station Wednesday
